title: (x) Alternatives to Eurostile? - various suggestions {gang}
content:
Hello everyone,

I'm currently working on a rebranding of a fashion brand that uses  
Eurostile. We would like to propose a new typeface with a fresher look  
that wouldnt be very different from eurostile, any ideas?

Thank you very much  
Diogo
author: dsoares1

comments.content: It's used for the logo or for other?

[The Foundry Monoline](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013175221/http:/www.foundrytypes.co.uk/foundry_monoline/monoline.html), [Typetrust Breuer Text](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013175221/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/typetrust/breuer-text/), [HI House Gothic 23 light weights](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013175221/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/housegothic23), T-26 [Stak](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013175221/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/stak/) and [Distilla](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013175221/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/distilla/), Monotype [Scene](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013175221/http:/www.faces.co.uk/fonts/Monotype/Scene-MT18642113/), [Neo Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013175221/http:/www.faces.co.uk/fonts/Monotype-Imaging-Vols/Neo-Sans-12-fonts-MT000616273/) and [Neo Tech](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013175221/http:/www.faces.co.uk/fonts/Monotype/Neo-Tech-Regular-MT018795113/), [Thirstype Apex New](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013175221/http:/www.vllg.com/Thirstype/Apex_New)

I was also going to mention Foundry Monoline. My comedy answer would be Mecanorma Microgramma.

MyFont doesnt always get it right!  
 [morelike Microgramma](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013175221/http:/new.myfonts.com/morelike/2759/)

Meindinger popped up.

Biome, by Typophile regular Carl Crossgrove:  
 [http://biometype.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013175221/http:/biometype.com/ "http://biometype.com/")
